definitions.text: a flexible container with a single opening
examples: he stuffed his laundry into a large bag

definitions.text: the quantity of game taken in a particular period (usually by one person)
a place that the runner must touch before scoring
examples: he scrambled to get back to the bag

definitions.text: a container used for carrying money and small personal items or accessories (especially by women)
examples: she reached into her bag and found a comb

definitions.text: the quantity that a bag will hold
examples: he ate a large bag of popcorn

definitions.text: a portable rectangular container for carrying clothes
examples: he carried his small bag onto the plane with him
he was romancing the old bag for her money

definitions.text: mammary gland of bovids (cows and sheep and goats)
an activity that you like or at which you are superior
examples: chemistry is not my cup of tea
his bag now is learning to play golf

definitions.text: capture or kill, as in hunting
hang loosely, like an empty bag
bulge out; form a bulge outward, or be so full as to appear to bulge

examples: The supermarket clerk bagged the groceries
